source_item.foreign_context: Dining alone in many cultures is simply a matter of circumstance, often associated with business travel or a quick meal during a busy day. source_item.foreign_context: Expatriate (expat) families are those who live outside their native country, often for a parent's work assignment. source_item.foreign_context: Freshers' Week (in the UK) or Orientation Week (in the US) is the week before the start of the academic year at a university, filled with events to help new students acclimate. It includes campus tours, academic introductions, and numerous social events and parties organized by the university and student unions. While it shares the goal of building community, it is typically a university-wide event for newcomers, whereas the Korean MT is a more intimate, group-specific retreat that happens repeatedly.

source_item.foreign_context: Haute couture is the creation of exclusive, custom-fitted high-end fashion, traditionally made by hand from start to finish.
